bibl.title: M. L. Coovert for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. Order to Dismiss Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p: The President of the United States of America, To the Honorable the Judges of the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington

Greeting: Whereas, lately in the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington, before you, or some of you, in a cause betweenentitled in the matter of the application of M. L. Coovert for a writ of habeas corpus No. 279, wherein the order of the said circuit court, entered in said cause on the 22d day of June, A.D. 1893, is in the following words, riz;

as by the inspection of the transcript of the record of the said Circuit Court, which was brough into the Supreme Court of the United States by virtue of an appeal taken by the State of Washington
agreeably to the act of Congress, in such case made and provided, fully and at large appears.

And whereas, in the present term of October, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety-six, the said cause came on to be heard before the said Supreme Court, on the said transcript of record, and was argued by counsel:

On consideration whereof, It is now here ordered, adjudged, & decreed by this Court that the order of the said Circuit Court in this cause be, and the same is hereby, reversed with costs; And that the said The State of Washington recover against the said M. L. Coovert Sixty-two dollars and fifty cents for its costs herein expended and have execution therefor.
And it is further ordered that this cause be, and the same is hereby rewarded to the said Circuit Court with directions to discharge the writ and dismiss the petition.
Supreme Court of the United States. No. 96, October term 1896.
The State of Washington vs. M. L. Coovert
Filed July 23 1898 In the U. S. Circuit Court. A. Reeves Ayres Clerk HM Walker Deputy

You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such execution and further proceedings be had in said cause, in conformity with the opinion and decree of this Court as according to right and justice, and the laws of the United States, ought to be had, the said appeal notwithstanding.
Witness the Honorable Melwille W. Fuller, Chief Justice of the United States, the 22nd day of July, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and ninety-seven.
Costs of The State of Washington Clerk $26.00 Printing record $16.50 Attorney $20.00 $62.50
James H. M. Kenney Clerk of the Supreme Court of the United States
